questions.question_text:
A company's on-premises application deployment cycle was 3-4 weeks. After migrating to the AWS Cloud, the company can deploy the application in 2-3 days.
Which benefit has this company experienced by moving to the AWS Cloud?

discussion.content: I'm pretty sure it should be Agility

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. This is the definition of agility as per AWS : Increase speed and agility – In a cloud computing environment, new IT resources are only a click away, which means that you reduce the time to make those resources available to your developers from weeks to just minutes. This results in a dramatic increase in agility for the organization, since the cost and time it takes to experiment and develop is significantly lower.

Selected Answer: C
Agility refers to the ability to quickly develop, test, and deploy applications with minimal effort and time

Selected Answer: C
Agility

Selected Answer: C
Agility refers to the ability to rapidly develop, deploy, and iterate on applications. By migrating to AWS, the company has significantly reduced its deployment cycle from 3-4 weeks to 2-3 days, which demonstrates increased agility in the development and deployment process.

The admin that is correcting the answers are not in a good day's ... :(

Selected Answer: C
Definitely C

Agility.
Please refer : https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

Increase speed and agility – In a cloud computing environment, new IT resources are only a click away, which means that you reduce the time to make those resources available to your developers from weeks to just minutes. This results in a dramatic increase in agility for the organization, since the cost and time it takes to experiment and develop is significantly lower.
option C Agility is the right answer
Answer should be agility

Selected Answer: C
C. Agility

Agility refers to the ability to quickly adapt to changes and respond to new requirements or opportunities. In this scenario, the company has gained agility by leveraging the AWS Cloud, which allows for faster application deployment and enables the company to respond more quickly to business needs or market demands. This increased agility is a key advantage of cloud computing, as it enables organizations to innovate faster, improve time-to-market, and stay competitive in a rapidly evolving business landscape.
Agility is right answer, elasticity means to automate scaling process

Selected Answer: C
C for sure

Selected Answer: C
It should be C as it talks about the time decrease in procurement cycles
C Agility

Selected Answer: C
Agility

The answer is Agility.
Here is a similar question with a correct answer 
"An online company was running a workload on premises and was struggling to launch new products and features. After migrating the workload to AWS, the company can quickly launch products and features and can scale its infrastructure as required.
Which AWS Cloud value proposition does this scenario describe?
A. Business agility Most Voted
B. High availability
C. Security
D. Centralized auditing
 
Correct Answer: A "

Selected Answer: BE
B. AWS CodeCommit
E. AWS CodePipeline

AWS CodeCommit is a fully-managed source control service that makes it easy to store, manage, and track changes to your code. CodeCommit is designed to be highly scalable, and it can store and manage code for any number of projects, including large monolithic repositories and multi-repo projects.

AWS CodePipeline is a fully managed continuous delivery service that helps you automate your release pipelines for fast and reliable application and infrastructure updates. CodePipeline automates the build, test, and deployment stages of your release process every time there is a code change, based on the release model you choose. CodePipeline integrates with CodeCommit, so you can use CodePipeline to automatically build, test, and deploy code changes that you make in CodeCommit.

Selected Answer: BE
CodeCommit for Version control and Code Pipeline for Deployment

AWS CODEPIPELINE : It will be build, test, and deployment stages of your release process every time there is a code change, based on the release model you choose.

Selected Answer: BE
B. AWS CodeCommit: AWS CodeCommit is a fully managed source control service that makes it easy for teams to host secure and scalable Git repositories.

E. AWS CodePipeline: AWS CodePipeline is a continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) service that automates the build, test, and deployment phases of your release process.

Selected Answer: BE
B. AWS CodeCommit

AWS CodePipeline then builds, tests, and deploys your application according to the defined workflow every time there is a code change"

E. AWS CodePipeline is a continuous delivery service that automates the building, testing, and deployment of code changes to any application or infrastructure on AWS. It works in conjunction with AWS CodeCommit and other AWS services to provide a fully automated CI/CD pipeline.

questions.question_text:
A company needs to store code in a version control system. The company also needs to continually deploy updated code through a series of automated steps (build, test, package, and deploy).

Which combination of AWS services will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

An ecommerce company has deployed a new web application on Amazon EC2 instances. The company wants to distribute incoming HTTP traffic evenly across all running instances.

Which AWS service or resource will meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Application Load Balancers are used to route HTTP/HTTPS traffic.

Selected Answer: B
An Application Load Balancer (ALB) is a service provided by AWS that distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as Amazon EC2 instances, in multiple Availability Zones. It is designed to handle HTTP and HTTPS traffic and provides advanced routing features.

In this case, the ecommerce company can use an Application Load Balancer (ALB) to evenly distribute incoming HTTP traffic across all running Amazon EC2 instances hosting the web application. ALBs also provide features like path-based routing, host-based routing, and integration with various AWS services, making them suitable for a wide range of application scenarios.

Selected Answer: B
B. Application Load Balancer

Selected Answer: B
What is gateway balancer?
Great reference: https://tutorialsdojo.com/application-load-balancer-vs-network-load-balancer-vs-gateway-load-balancer/

Selected Answer: B
Application Load Balancer

 Routes and load balances at the application layer (HTTP/HTTPS), and supports path-based routing. An Application Load Balancer can route requests to ports on one or more registered targets, such as EC2 instances, in your virtual private cloud (VPC).

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are advantages of moving from on premises to the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B. Moving to the AWS Cloud can eliminate the costs associated with running and maintaining on-premises data centers, such as hardware procurement, maintenance, cooling, power, and facility costs.

C. AWS operates at a massive scale, which allows them to achieve economies of scale that can lead to cost savings for customers. This is especially beneficial for businesses since they can leverage AWS's existing infrastructure and resources to achieve cost efficiency.

Selected Answer: BC
B. Eliminate costs related to running and maintaining data centers.
C. Benefit from massive economies of scale.

I know that's the right answer but the "eliminate costs of running data centre" element of these questions always irritates as you don't eliminate the costs, you just pay amazon for them to run your slice of their data centre. Sorry i know it's pedantic.

comments.content: "eliminate costs of running your own data centre, by renting a slice of theirs" :-)

discussion.content: B & C The advantages of moving from on-premises to the AWS Cloud include the ability to benefit from massive economies of scale and eliminate costs related to running and maintaining data

Selected Answer: BC
agreed

Selected Answer: BC
Answer is B & C

Selected Answer: BC
BC is the answer.

Selected Answer: BC
Answer: BC

Selected Answer: BC
Agreed. Check this out:

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

choices.A: Trade variable expenses for capital expenses.
choices.C: Benefit from massive economies of scale.
choices.E: Gam the ability to reserve capacity for 7 years or more.
choices.D: Eliminate the need to tram IT staff.
choices.B: Eliminate costs related to running and maintaining data centers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Amazon ElastiCache is a caching service that can be used to improve database performance by reducing the amount of read I/O on the database. By caching frequently accessed data in-memory, ElastiCache reduces the number of read operations that are sent to the database, thus improving the overall performance of the database. Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) is also a caching service, but it is designed for Amazon DynamoDB, not Amazon RDS. Amazon EMR is a big data processing service, and Amazon Redshift is a data warehousing service, neither of which are specifically designed to improve the performance of an Amazon RDS database.

Selected Answer: C
Amazon ElastiCache is an AWS service that provides in-memory data caching. It can be used to improve the performance of I/O intensive applications, including databases like Amazon RDS, by reducing the load on the database backend. ElastiCache supports popular caching engines like Redis and Memcached. By caching frequently accessed data in-memory, ElastiCache can significantly reduce the database load and improve overall application performance.

Selected Answer: C
C. Amazon ElastiCache

"Amazon ElastiCache improves the performance of web applications by allowing you to retrieve information from a fast, managed, in-memory system, instead of relying entirely on slower disk-based databases."

https://aws.amazon.com/elasticache/faqs/

Amazon ElastiCache is an in-memory data store that is designed to improve the performance of web applications and other I/O intensive workloads. By using ElastiCache, the company can reduce the number of read requests to the Amazon RDS database, thereby improving its performance.

Selected Answer: C
no doubts
C is the answer.

Selected Answer: C
by elimination

Answer C - Elasticache. 

Link: https://aws.amazon.com/elasticache/faqs/

questions.question_text:
A company is using an Amazon RDS database to run reports that are input/output (I/O) intensive.

Which AWS service can be used to improve the database performance?
